issue.title: [Doc][Python] Documentation missing for pyarrow.Table
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-12599](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12599). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
On <https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/api/tables.html> the link to `Table` (the class not the factory function) is missing.  Furthermore, typing in the link manually leads me to docs for the factory function.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12599?focusedCommentId=17335548) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
Hmm, that's curious. The other links for eg RecordBatch do work fine, while in the rst file they are included in the same way.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12599?focusedCommentId=17335556) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
In my local doc build, it works fine.

But something that I noticed: in the online docs, the link for `pyarrow.table` (the factory function) is https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/generated/pyarrow.Table.html#pyarrow.table, so which is pointing to the page for the class (but the content is for the function). 

So I assume something somewhere in sphinx is going wrong with a case (in)sensitivity. And this might be a bug in sphinx since I was using sphinx 3.4.3 locally, and the online ones are built with the latest 3.5.4. Will test locally with the latest version as well to verify.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12599?focusedCommentId=17335578) by Weston Pace (westonpace):*
It could also be whatever we are using to host the docs.  Static file servers sometimes have options for case sensitivity.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12599?focusedCommentId=17338397) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
> It could also be whatever we are using to host the docs.  Static file servers sometimes have options for case sensitivity.

I don't think that's the issue, as it's the actual HTML generated by sphinx that doesn't include the proper link.

Now, I can't reproduce this, also not locally using sphinx 3.5.4.  
`[~kszucs]` do you know what environment you used to build the docs? Eg the Python version?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12599?focusedCommentId=17338402) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
I generated the docs in a docker container. I have case-insensitive filesystem which might be the cause, that's why I generated the docs inside the container without mounted directories - perhaps docker still uses the same filesystem.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12599?focusedCommentId=17338407) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
I'm going to regenerate the docs on a linux machine (I didn't have access to it when I originally generated the docs for 4.0). Hopefully that will resolve the case-insensitivity problem.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-12599?focusedCommentId=17338634) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
Should be resolved now https://arrow.apache.org/docs/python/generated/pyarrow.Table.html#pyarrow.Table
